location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.154 of 1854 from Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Henry Anderson, Secretary to the Government of Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter relates to two enslaved boys who absconded from Muscat on board the Honourable Companyâ€™s steam frigate Ajdaha. Kemball writes that, because the Ajdahahad departed Muscat, he informed Captain Barker of the Ajdahathat the two boys were at liberty to choose their own destiny. The two boys chose to remain at Bassidore under the charge of Commodore Robinson, until the opportunity arose to send them to the Presidency at Bombay.
